etymology.description: Derived from 辛(辛) (xīn, "bitter" or "difficult"), depicting a chisel tool
etymology.interpretation: The character 丵(zhuó, "tool for digging") represents a chisel or tool used for digging and cutting. It has evolved directly from 辛(辛) through its visual depiction.

examples.chinese: 农夫拿起丵(農夫拿起丵)，开始在土里挖坑(開始在土裡挖坑)。
examples.pinyin: Nóng fū ná qǐ zhuó, kāishǐ zài tǔ lǐ wā kēng.
examples.english: The farmer picked up the digging tool and began to dig a pit in the soil.

examples.chinese: 建筑工人手持丵(建築工人手持丵)，在工地上认真挖掘基坑(在工地上認真挖掘基坑)。
examples.pinyin: Jiànzhú gōngrén shǒuchí zhuó, zài gōngdì shàng rènzhēn wājué jīkēn.
examples.english: The construction worker held the digging tool firmly and excavated the foundation pit at the site.

examples.chinese: 孩子在院子里用丵(孩子在院子裡用丵)，挖出了一个秘密地道(挖出了一個秘密地道)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi zài yuànzi lǐ yòng zhuó, wā chūle yī gè mìmì dìdào.
examples.english: The child used the digging tool in the yard and dug out a secret tunnel.
